TopicTitle: Are you interested in second screen support

Articles.Content:
Hello guys,

One of the things I realize while playing KSP is how cluttered my UI gets. With all the flight data, TAC Monitor, IR controls...Let's says sometimes I don't even see my own ship ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I am considering doing a "mod" that should allow to move reasonable amount of that info out of the main game windows. It will be based on the amazing [KRPC](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/69313-WIP-1-0-2-kRPC-Remote-Procedure-Call-Server-v0-1-9-14th-May-2015/) from djungelorm. The main program will later load "modules" that will be draw in the second screen (this will be something in Windows.Forms or GTK#, not unity). With enough dev effort, many things can be done, both to the game and to addons. Not only request data, but also control the game/addons

The problem is that it requires quite some work (many already done, many still pending). In my mind, the kind of things I would love to be able to do are:

- Control my RT antennas

- Have a copy of TAC Life Monitor

- Be able to use TAC FB in that screen

- Set the KAC alarms

Wil you people be interested in something like that?

I would be more interested in a map view on the second screen. That way I don't have to switch between flight and map. ^^

If you could can display something like a RasterPropMonitor screen (or several of them) go for it! That would be really useful.

The one thing that I would absolutely love from a multi-monitor setup would be having map view permanently on a second display.

The examples you quote would be nice to have, but not so essential for me personally. I don't mean to dissuade you however, I could see many in the community wanting these things.

An attempt at a second screen map, via 2 game sessions juggling access to the same saved game data, has been stalled for a while, [check out this thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/76273-Stand-Alone-Map-View-Multi-monitor-KSP-0-25-WIP-Plugin).

([Thanks to reddit user Kog](http://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/3aviqy/devnote_tuesday_patching_for_days/csggqha)[ster](http://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/3aviqy/devnote_tuesday_patching_for_days/csggqha) for writing about it, I'd never have known otherwise )

Apparently the Map view is the ideal output. Sadly, I doubt that one is feasible without using another instance of the game (like what basic.syntax and Kogster pointed out) or with direct Squad support.

> Apparently the Map view is the ideal output. Sadly, I doubt that one is feasible without using another instance of the game (like what basic.syntax and Kogster pointed out) or with direct Squad support.

Perhaps so, in which case I rather hope it's something Squad have considered.

Nonetheless, I do think some of the ideas you have proposed have merit. Two replies do not really represent the preferences of the community as a whole. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I'd give it a bit more time before drawing any firm conclusions.

@Razhan

The map doesn't need to look like the one in the game. A display similiar to RPM is more than enough. That one only shows the planet as a circle and your vessels orbit as an ellipse. More importantly it shows all the orbit data.

You don't have to come up with fancy graphics!
